name: Disturbed
description: Play as a farmer who struggles to manage a failing farm. You come to a point where there is no more hope, and you must do something.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or later Processor: 1.2 Ghz Memory: 256 MB RAM Storage: 150 MB available space

reviews.review_text: You are a farmer throwen into world destroyed by plague and you are trying to do something with it, it is all black-white drawen and it adds good atmosphere. Achievements are awarded mostly for deaths = tons of endings :D. Game saves automaticly, so you dont have to worry about losing whole progress by one bad choice. Good game i recommend.  pros:  + it is free + all achievements working + good story + no bugs + auto saves  no cons :)

Disturbed is an entertaining dark fantasy visual novel. Those who grew up lost within the Underground Empire of  Zork  or  Choose Your Adventure  novels will instantly feel at home here. The storyline has branching options but most will lead toward doom. Few options reward the player. Instead, every choice carries the gravity of possible death behind it. The atmosphere is oppressive and intriguing.  Disturbed  is FREE and well worth taking for a quick spin. Just do not expect to breeze through it without the trail-and-error experimentation of bygone eras.

Great game for no cost. It suppose to be a horror game butit's not really horror even though death is around every corner. Even the trees can kill you. This game plays a lot more like those old school point and click games like King's Quest, Gabriel Knights or Phantasmagoria. It's text based so you do need to pay attention to what you are reading and doing. In this game you should save often because you will die and have to start over again. It's not bad for a free game, it's not really horror but it is fun. Try it, it's free. 7/10
Short, free and memorable game

YES  I'm not really a fan of point and click games, but this one got me so HYPED when I actually started to solve the puzzles, and it was REALLY fun to play!  And the clever death achievements made me laugh.  Thanks for making an awesome game!
Nice history, and nice gameplay, short game but I have enjoyed every minute ;)
So far it seems good but I have not put nearly enough time in it to give it a thorough review ;)
Really nice short puzzle/horror game  Great story and cool artwork  Story line feels kinda like Lord Of The Ring...
Free, quick to 100%, and semi-enjoyable.  The art was decent but nothing too compelling.  The story still confuses me a tiny bit but it was a nice little choose your own adventure visual novel.
Play it its free! I did like the game
Disturbed is a cool, dark, 'adventure' game, its short, its free, its on Steam. If you are interested at all you should try it, you probably will not be disappointing.
Fun little game, definitely worth a try.  Wish it was a bit longer, but it is free after all.  Hopefully the devs make another like this :)
Really frustrating at parts, but super satisfying when you figure it out. 8/10

i can't remember the last time i put this much effort into dungeon mapping for a free game. needs a little bit of spell checking, but definitely a solid game. great artwork, decent map and plot. it's like playing a text adventure with some graphics.

An interesting, original horror game that takes a twist.  Don't judge it by the screenshots that you see of it on the store page, as it's far more interesting than what they make it out to be.  The game does take patience, but just play the game, get into the story line, and enjoy yourself.
A short and fun game. It's also great for achievements. :b
Witcher peasant simulator! Become a peasant, leave the safety of your small farm and head out into the big world..   and die... a lot...
Played 15 minutes, died 8 times. Would play 15 more minutes and die another 8 times!

I had about an hour and a half of enjoyable playtime. The only thing I would change would be to add a suitably subdued, subtly eerie soundtrack to fulfil the game's atmosphere. I'll be looking for other projects from the same creator.
I just wanted to cuddle with the momma bear...

My Experience - A very unusual game, interesting art style, and a surplus of choices to follow through on. It's nothing too special, but it's free and if you've got an hour or two to play through this completely you won't be disappointed. It took me a little over an hour to get every achievment and beat the game, it might have taken me a little less had I discovered that there was an option to save.  Do I recommend this game? - Absolutely  TL;DR - Interesting free game.

Not sure what they were going for here. I'd rather play Zork and let my imagination do the art. I know it can be hard to program and also make drawings but this didn't feel like a game at all. It honestly could have been done by 1 person. Thank goodness I did not pay anything.
Boring game, it's just trial and error.
Wtf ! -_-  Pros : +A little good story  Cons : -wtf ! :| -boring -no gameplay -wtf again -you lose  GG Doesn't worth at all ! i don't know even why did i download it
What an amazing game!  You'll die. You'll die multiple times, in disturbing ways. But once you get how the puzzle 'works'...splendid! But finished quickly :(  Can't believe it's free!

A neat, short, and dark choose your own adventure story where you are an unknown farmer simply trying to survive from the terrible plague that is affecting the land you live in.  I really liked the art style they used for it, very minimalistic. Plus there are many things that will attempt to kill you in gory ways, so it's not as straightforward as you may think!  It's also free! Try it out.

Disturbed is an adventure/choose your own adventure type of game. You are traversing a map trying to solve the riddles. The events are fixed per scene so once you figure it out then you know to avoid it or to trying to fit it in properly in the sequence of events. It takes about an hour to beat.  I found the game fairly mediocre overall, but decided on giving an upvote since it is free. I was not a huge fan of the art, but that is a matter of personal taste. I also found there was not enough variety in the scenes, with the story too linear. First decision A or B; try A, die, so restart and choose B; next decision C or D; choose C; die; so start again, choose B, then D, etc. It is very linear and you basically go from scene to scene and trial and error. After you are a number of choices in, you have to repeat a lot of scenes just so you can arbitrarily die in some decision.  I see this as a poor man's version of 'The Forest of Doom.' Very similar plot of being in a forest, but much nicer graphics, better decision tree, but costs about $2 on sale.   Another free alternative to this game is 'The Bottom of the Well' - a grim adventure tale, but where the story is actually very interesting and complex.
Spent about an hour and a half to get all the achievements in this game and i didnt rage quit it ,, check it out,, you die alot
best 30+ minutes of the last couple of weeks
A fun little adventure, try it out!
It's free! It's quite fun to play if you are trying to spend some free time on something.
A F2P game with an intriguing story. It is not very short, but not so long. It could be hard to finish the game; It depends on player's choices. It is free...so give him a chance.

I thoroughly enjoyed this game, in one word? Brilliant.  From the art style, death descriptions and general pace - I am hugely impressed.  Love the writing style; this is definitely a game worth dying for! (You'll know what I mean if you dare to play!) Puzzles - tick. Deaths - tick. Creepy art style - tick.  Looking forward to more like this in the future. Pro +  + Beautiful in a twisted disturbed way.  + The quick save feature is AMAZING.  Con -  - If you can't commit to a little bit of story and puzzle-solving, you might want to give this a pass.  - Not for those who rage quit with a high death rate.  I would definitely recommend this game to people who are fans of text based fantasy games, a little bit of dark humour and those who appreciate a bit of the darker art styles around.  Give it a go. It's short, sweet and dare I say it, deathly good.

This game made me laugh out loud with some of the death fails in it. From giant spiders to hungry bears to demons, you just never know whats around the corner. The graphics are very art gothic and there is little else but dialogue to interact with so don't expect anything else. I really enjoy this one, just remember to save, which I didn't even realise I could do until I'd restarted 7 times....

I like the game, but it is not really scary in my opinion. I finished it after 1.2 hours but two achivements are still missing. If you like visual novels I highly recommend 'Disturbed' as a game to play along the way. But once you finished it, you probably wouldn't play it again because the plot is already revealed and the story doesn't change either.

This game was Pretty Good in my opinion, a little short but still a great story with some neat little puzzles and a really depressing atmosphere as well. If your into choose your own story/adventure games then download this it's not bad at all.

I recommend this game if you're into choose your own adventure books. However if you are also into puzzel games I would also suggest this game. The art style is very unique and it gives very good detail to the scenery that you are in. Don't get me wrong if you are more of a fast paced game player you won't enjoy tis game but if you do like playing for the story then I would say give it a download and a quick play.
I WANT MORE OF THIS GAME!
It got me down with the sickness.
Nice Drawings. Comic Book Design is Awesome. Only 25 mb . and Its a Horror Too. Expecting More From Part2

The deaths in this game are stupid and come out of no where, they just blind side you and there is no way to know what you're doing is the right or wrong choice, went to sleep killed me, picked a mushroom that killed me, didnt go to sleep that killed me. the art style is fairly appealing but you're so focused on the text as you're reading so carefully into whats happening so that you don't pay attention to the art at all. the game forces you into situations you don't want to be in. its a free game and i can see the maker of this game got their inspiration from those old adventure book games like ian livingstone but this is so basic and unforgiving to the point its just frustrating and annoying. I think if it was polished and the creator maybe focused on the story and the choices the player can make it would be a better game. i played for 10 minutes and just got annoyed for dying without any reason every ten seconds.

It´s a really fun game with an interesting turning in all sides , at first it feels like a random option picking system but later on all makes sense, the dialogues/actions and visual that are to follow and the hilarious ways to die are something that you dont usually look for in a game but you will in this one and is really satisfying i´m looking forward to a sequel that last more and have more content i would even pay for it gladly although i love free stuff

Disturbed is very thought out and well put together accept for some spelling errors. I love this game and played it a few times so if your looking for a quick entertaining game this is the one. If you couldn't tell from the trailer, this game is just clicking and choosing and all that. It can be creepy and very confusing but once you get into it its pretty easy. I reccomend this game for anyone looking for a short game they can delete in two hours (like me but I kept mine).

This game was fun! I loved the art and the feel of it, Like a choose your own way book! I got all the cheevos, but 1, need to figure that one out... btw, is the shed a lie? hahaha! Looking forward to Disturbed 2!!

This game was built in the classic 'choose your adventure' style. You make decisions every time, and those might let you go on or end your quest. So you basically have to learn which choices are bad so you can start the game again (or load your saved games) and progress. You may or may not like this style of game, but the setting the dev managed to create is pretty unique and disturbed. Immersion at its best. This is a quick game but you will easily get stuck. If you don't want to watch walkthroughs this will surely be a chalenge. I recommend this because it is free and quite unique. There is also interest growing for more stories about this strange world of Disturbed.

This game is neat. Simple graphics and gameplay, but quite entertaining. Interesting characters to talk to (the few you do talk to). Seems to be geared to how many different ways can you die. Even the achievements are that way. Had many 'what, I'm dead again?!' moments. Game is short, but a nice deviation from the advanced/complicated 'modern' type games. Kind of a throwback to early graphical text adventure games.

There is really nothing bad to say about this game. Great choose-your-own style adventure game with awesome visuals and art, intersting and intuitive story and puzzles, and a whole lot of trial and error. I love coming back again and again to throw myself into this whimsical and unforgiving fantasy world.
